prompt_used:
Create a watercolor-style children's book illustration (1792x1024 landscape) for the following stanza from a poem about Emma. This is image 1 of 8 in the storybook:
In a cozy nursery filled with toys and light, little Emma giggles with pure delight. Her tiny hands reach up to touch the mobile above, while her parents watch with endless love.
Style Requirements:
- Watercolor technique with soft, warm color palette (creams, pastels, gentle earth tones)
- Hand-drawn, storybook aesthetic with visible brush strokes and texture
- Soft, diffused lighting that creates a dreamy atmosphere
- Gentle, rounded edges and organic shapes
- Subtle paper texture visible in the background
- Whimsical details like floating leaves, sparkles, or soft shadows to add depth
Character Requirements:
- If Emma appears: A 6-month-old baby with rosy cheeks, bright blue eyes, and soft golden curls. She has a small birthmark on her left cheek and a sweet, dimpled smile. - maintain exact skin tone, hair color/texture, and any distinctive features
- If Sarah appears: A young mother with warm brown eyes, long auburn hair in a loose braid, and a gentle smile. She has fair skin with freckles across her nose. - maintain exact skin tone, hair color/texture, and any distinctive features
- If Michael appears: A tall father with kind hazel eyes, short dark brown hair with a touch of gray at the temples, and a friendly face. He has olive skin and a neatly trimmed beard. - maintain exact skin tone, hair color/texture, and any distinctive features
- If Grandma Rose appears: An elderly woman with silver-white hair in a neat bun, twinkling blue eyes behind round glasses, and a warm smile. She has fair skin with gentle wrinkles and always wears a pearl necklace. - maintain exact skin tone, hair color/texture, and any distinctive features
Composition Requirements:
- This is a two-page spread (left and right pages)
- For odd-numbered images (1,3,5,7):
  * Place the main illustration on the right page
  * Leave the left page as negative space for text
  * Ensure the illustration flows naturally from left to right
  * Add subtle decorative elements in the negative space that complement the scene
- For even-numbered images (2,4,6,8):
  * Place the main illustration on the left page
  * Leave the right page as negative space for text
  * Ensure the illustration flows naturally from right to left
  * Add subtle decorative elements in the negative space that complement the scene
- Center the main action or emotion of the stanza in the illustrated page
- Use the rule of thirds for balanced composition within the illustrated page
- Create depth through layered elements (foreground, midground, background)
- Ensure all elements are soft-edged and blend harmoniously
- Add subtle environmental details that reflect the stanza's mood
Technical Requirements:
- Resolution: 1792x1024 pixels (full spread)
- Aspect ratio: 16:9 landscape
- Format: High-quality digital watercolor
- Style consistency: Match the established children's book aesthetic
- Color harmony: Use a cohesive, warm color palette
- Lighting: Soft, natural lighting with gentle shadows
Negative Space Requirements:
- Maintain a clear, unobstructed area for text placement
- For odd-numbered images: Left side (approximately 1/3 of the width)
- For even-numbered images: Right side (approximately 1/3 of the width)
- Add subtle, non-distracting decorative elements in the negative space
- Ensure the negative space feels intentional and balanced
- Keep the negative space area slightly lighter in tone for better text readability
Additional Notes:
- Maintain consistent character designs across all illustrations
- Ensure all text elements will be legible when overlaid
- Keep the style child-friendly and emotionally warm
- Avoid any harsh lines or contrasting elements
- Include subtle textures and patterns that add warmth
- Ensure the illustration feels like a natural part of a storybook sequence
- Consider the flow of the story across pages (left-to-right for odd pages, right-to-left for even pages)
